Cannot set data in clipboard
*** Bug 63564 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I can reproduce it anytime I want. See
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=63564

I short, what causes it for me:
- have Terminal services connections/sessions
- turn folding on
- type Ctrl-C (Ctrl-X) in Java file (or several fast Ctrl-C's)

What doesn't affect it:
- version (M9, I20040526, ever some older integration builds)
- plugins (clean or many plugins - same)

When it doesn't happen:
- Copy or cut from menu
- in non-Java files
- when folding is off
- sometimes when saving and after some wait Ctrl-C works OK (timing or thread
issue?)
Comment #2 is not the same problem and is a duplicate of bug 66285.

Unable to reproduce with RC2, on RedHat 9.0 / GTK, however. 

I suspect that the clipboard was in a bad state when you reproduced this - for
example, an other application could have locked the clipboard or such.

One fix would be to guard against clipboard failure instead of falling all the
way out - however, then the clipboard problem would never be communicated to the
user.

We should really guard against DND.ERROR_CANNOT_SET_CLIPBOARD everywhere we use
Clipboard.setContents as this exception can always occur like a checked
excpetion. A fix will be to catch these and handle appropriately:

- ask the user what to do
- log
- propagate where we cannot do either of the above

Created an attachment (id=12227)
ProjectionViewer.java.diff

Fixes the uncaught SWTError when setting the clipboard in ProjectionViewer.java

Created an attachment (id=12228)
org.eclipse.ui.workbench.texteditor.diff

Fixes the uncaught SWTError in DeleteLineTarget.java

Deleting a line fails upon a clipboard error; the error is logged and a dialog
shown.

These two instances are the only ones where we accessed the clipboard
unprotectedly in platform/jdt-text.

approved by Kai:
- removed the dialog from DeleteLineTarget, but still we log and fail

fixed > 20040617 for 1600 build

files: 
- DeleteLineTarget.java
- ProjectionViewer.java

Verified that repeatedly delete lines doesn't through an exception anymore. 
Furthermore proved that ProjectionViewer#copyToClipboard and 
DeleteLineTarget#deleteLine handle the case that the clipboard can't be set.
